instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fanspin loops 3 times before steadily turns on [SOLVED]
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

Wasn't sure how to name this tread. I am dealing with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board today which had extensive water damage.

After replacing couple caps and fixing traces around G3H it turns on, but it takes it 3 cycles to become stable and load into system, on bare board without any intervention after i attach the charger.

This happens every time i feed power: Turns on 0.4 - 0.6A draw for 2-6sec with no light on screen or matrix. Drops to 0.1A for couple secs. Then 0.4-0.6 again for couple secs and drops to 0.1A
Third time fires up and loads into system. After couple times looping like that switches off with 0.03A draw.

After third cycle, stays stable as usual system and can run for hours.

Between all these cycles no intervention by me.

S0 voltages fine.

Not sure what power sections to post.

Thanks in advance

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fanspin loops 3 times before steadily turns on [SOLVED]
threads.message:
A good <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> should cycle ON OFF for I think 2 or 3 times before turning on.

Pretty sure this is normal.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fanspin loops 3 times before steadily turns on [SOLVED]
threads.message: Thanks dude. Haven't seen this with 00165 boards. It got me.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fanspin loops 3 times before steadily turns on [SOLVED]
threads.message: 00165 do not do this, it has something to do with the Haswell chips and the SYSCLK chip? I think? not too sure why but this is 100% normal.
